website_summaries.verdict: Thoughtful details like numerous mesh-lined vents and an extended visor maximize your child's comfort.
pros: Vents lined with insect mesh to keep bugs out
Extended visor provides extra sun protection
Available in 2 sizes and several colors
cons: Buckle is challenging for children to operate independently
Many say this helmet seems to run small

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 2 uses.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know if I got a faulty one or what but it broke after two uses and he’s 2 he can’t take it off or put it on and he only used it for a few minutes and it’s broken clean off. Really disappointed especially for a $30 helmet.
customer_reviews.author: Josh S

customer_reviews.title: Way way way too small
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a good product, but it's way too small for my 15 month old son. Granted, he has a big head, but for this to fit a 4 year old seems nuts. The actual helmet looks like it should fit, but when you actually have to squeeze the noggin in there, it's laughable.
customer_reviews.author: CJK

customer_reviews.title: Different versions
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this helmet for my daughter. My son was gifted the orange one last week. The two sizes are the same but the quality is vastly different. His helmet has low grade inserts while she has a streamlined style with better chin strap. It seems that our sons is the older version.
customer_reviews.author: HUSKYGOLFER

customer_reviews.title: Easy adjustments
customer_reviews.text: My 12 month old son tolerates this helmet very well and looks super cute in it. I love the twist design on the back of the helmet to quickly tighten and loosen each time so that it is perfectly adjusted to his head. I wish it had netting in all of the holes but I’m glad it had it in the front at least.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Ramberg

customer_reviews.title: I like the design for my 3 year old with a ...
customer_reviews.text: I like the design for my 3 year old with a large head. Lightweight and has additional foam in the back. Adjustable straps are ok with removable inserts that appear washable. My only real gripe is my particular helmet's straps were all twisted and coiled. Whoever did this did not pay attention or was careless so I can't use these without worrying about a strap twisting an ear or grabbing hair. There is no way to fix it yourself because the parts are permanently attached. Will be returning for another.
customer_reviews.author: Squirrelisan

customer_reviews.title: Very well designed and made helmet!
customer_reviews.text: Great design & quality, has integrated visor, and light weight. I feel kiddo's head is well protected with this helmet (see pics). My 2.5 year old wears the xs/s, and she seems very comfortable and doesn't get too hot, despite an abundance of paddings within helmet, including on the dial. My 7 year old wears s/m size. It fits him perfectly as well. The helmet's bright color, while isn't fancy or anything, helps me spot him from far away! In short, it's a very functional helmet that does the job well.
customer_reviews.author: Tea

customer_reviews.title: DANGEROUS - Poor quality - unsafe - bad assembly
customer_reviews.text: One of the chin strap clips fell off while my 2yo was riding in our bike mounted child seat. We only used this helmet maybe a dozen times and it was never dropped and always stored indoors. The black plastic piece was poorly taped and came off with no encouragement after just a few uses as well. VERY UNSAFE and have seen multiple similar reviews regarding these issues. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, broke after only a few uses
customer_reviews.text: This helmet seemed great at first, however after only a few uses the straps become completely undone. I contacted the manufacturer to see how to redo the straps, they said they can no be redone, it is too complicated. So instead they offered to send me a replacement helmet. Great! Unfortunately they never actually sent the replacement helmet. I contacted them multiple times to follow up and never received a response from them.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Shorts

customer_reviews.title: great helmet, nice fit.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace cheap department store helmet that wouldn't stay on the child's head. The fit for this is MUCH BETTER. The harness design cradles the head snugly, and one knob at the back is all that is needed to tighten or loosen the fit. I also like the lip on the front visor. my grandson has already taken a nose dive with it on and this saved him from smashing his face. But the best part is the fit - no helmet is any good if it won't stay on the child's head or if he refuses to wear it. good job Joovy.
customer_reviews.author: Bob E.

customer_reviews.title: Great toddler helmet
customer_reviews.text: Just bought our third of this helmet (Each kid needed an XS last summer and my older now needs a S). My two kids have worn these in the bike trailer and while riding their balance bikes. They are happy to wear them, which is crucial in my mind. The helmets are light, come in fun colors and the chin strap have a soft cover. The interior adjustments keep them fitting well as my kids have grown. They have been dropped a bunch of times and barely show any scuffs. My only complaint is that they are a little bulky/wide (but that seems to be par for the course with helmets).
customer_reviews.author: KSG

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow - head circumference is not the only consideration!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this helmet for my 2-year-old, and per the head circumference measurement, it should have fit fine, with an extra inch to spare. When we tried to put it on him though, it just sat stuck about 2 inches above his ear and would not go down because of the very narrow width. The adjustment in the back only makes it tighter front-to-back. I'm ordering a size up, but hopefully it's not so big then that it doesn't stay on. It's disappointing since he got a new birthday scooter that he can't safely ride right now.
customer_reviews.author: Kplandish

customer_reviews.title: Perfect helmet for our two-year old.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing fit! I'm not sure if other reviewers looked at the item description before ordering--I measured our kid's head, and it fell within the head circumference range for this helmet. He's on the larger end of the fit range, but it fits snugly and securely--much better than another "multisport" helmet I purchased several months ago. It even has padding under the chin for comfort. I love that the helmet is easily adjustable, so I'll be able to hand it down to our younger son when he's ready. Apparently, it's also rather comfortable, because our kid wore it the entire evening after it arrived. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Schep

customer_reviews.title: Perfect first helmet
customer_reviews.text: This is a great first helmet. My son is almost two and we purchased a medium and it fits great. It’s pretty lightweight and easily adjustable. The strap under the chin seems as soft and comfortable as possible and so far, my son doesn’t mind wearing it! It’s sturdy and I feel confident that if he fell, his head would be fully protected.
customer_reviews.author: Meg RTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Great helmet
customer_reviews.text: I looked at a couple other cheaply helmets but loved the color of this. I love Joovy products in general as well. My daughter is 10 months old 43cm head. Since it’s winter we use a beanie or her hood under the helmet and it makes the fit much better. It’s slightly big but glad she’ll be able to use it for years to come! It’s fully adjustable and a great helmet
customer_reviews.author: Ashley P.

customer_reviews.title: It's too small for your average two year old.
customer_reviews.text: I love this helmet and so does my toddler. It's a beautiful color and the design is nice. Bought it for him when he turned two. He's two and a half now, and he's outgrown it. It's too small. My guy is 50%tile for head circumference. The age range on this should be up to age two. I feel like I was misled.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pass and try one on in person
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the foam part may be OK, But there are two huge problems. The sizing is in accurate, and the strap isn’t secure. I measured my sons head circumference before buying, and he was well under the cut off for extra small, but it fits uncomfortably snug. He does have more of a round head shape than elongated, but I’m wishing I had gone with my first instinct and bought the size up. Also, the adjustable strap does not stay put And becomes loose each time he wears it.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for my 3 1/2 yr old!
customer_reviews.text: This helmet is great for my 3 1/2 year old boy. His head measurement was about 20", thick hair included, so I purchased a size S/M in orange. It came a lot earlier than expected and was easy to adjust, and fits perfect. I've always struggled with toddler/young child helmets and was really pleased that this fit securely and with snug adjustments (no loose tangly straps and floppy design). A plus is that my son is actually happy with the way it fits and so far isn't fighting me to wear it on his tricycle rides around the neighborhood!
customer_reviews.author: A.NzTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Not safe
customer_reviews.text: Strap doesn’t stay tight. Poor design. The strap comes loose every time child puts it on. Ordered different product, will throw this away, not safe
customer_reviews.author: Old Dan

customer_reviews.title: Check the sizing! Great helmet.
customer_reviews.text: When you order the Small on Amazon it's actually an Extra Small-Small. My son has a 47cm head and this helmet was snug, so it wouldn't last the summer. The Medium, which is actually Small-Medium, fits much better.
customer_reviews.author: Clara W.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect protection for scooter riders
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old loves riding his scooter. In the past week he felt twice and this helmet literally saved his face. When I saw him falling face forward, I was expecting to see a bloody nose. This helmet did its magic and my son's face had a big smile instead. It's definitely designed to protect not only the skull, but also little noses. Just make sure it's adjusted correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Mariana

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous chinstrap, this product should be taken off market.
customer_reviews.text: Two falls and two trips to the ER for our 4yo both times due to chin strap cutting into his chin. This product is dangerous and should be removed from the market. Our kid would definitely have been better off with no helmet than with this helmet. Both times split his chin open in the same spot. This last time, 7 sutures required to close it up, and now we have to worry about permanent scaring. Heartbreaking. Please don't buy this helmet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great helmet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my one year old daughter for when we attach the pull behind trailer to my bicycle. I still wanted her head to be protected just in case something were to happen. I haven't tried it on her yet, but I love the features of it. It also seems very high quality. In the back of the straps on the inside of the helmet is a little turn knob where I can loosen or tighten it. I really like that it can be used a little longer when her head is growing.
customer_reviews.author: karapg

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Broke within the month I missed the return window and ended up buying an original lol doll one that’s much sturdier this one feels very cheap like just a thin plastic covering the foam it creaks when you touch or press down on it. Would definitely not recommend or buy ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Well made - lightweight!
customer_reviews.text: While it seems to sit a bit “high” on my toddlers head, it does have some adjustments, primarily with the straps and a ratcheted dial on the back; that being said, it’s well made and I feel will protect him, should he need it. The only downside I see is that I’m not sure the chinstrap sufficiently secures the helmet to him - and I’m reluctant to tighten the straps too much... but this is likely user (parent) trial and error.
customer_reviews.author: Brickfan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! Tiny and fits great, got the xsm/sm and it fit perfect on my 18 month old, with room to grow. Love the vivid color (pink) and how lightweight it is. She objected for a few minutes until she realized I had one on too.
customer_reviews.author: belzerker

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: This is the biggest hunk of China junk! The buckle and straps keeps coming loose and falling off and good luck trying to tie it back together! I would never recommend this. The buckle under the chin keeps falling off!
customer_reviews.author: Jennie S

customer_reviews.title: Great all around
customer_reviews.text: My son is 1.5 years old and loves his helmet. I can tell he’s comfortable and I like that it’s airy. Perfect fit and adjustable as he grows.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Mendez

customer_reviews.title: X-small/small fits my 15-month-old
customer_reviews.text: At its smallest setting, this just fits my 15-month-old daughter. The coverage is good, she loves wearing it, and it is light enough that it doesn't seem to bother her to wear it for 30-minute rides. The chin strap is long, so we had to remove the padding to get it tight enough. The chin strap is also very slick, so we have to re-tighten it periodically. Overall, we're pleased with the helmet, and it should fit her for quite awhile as she grows into it.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Great helmet for our one year old
customer_reviews.text: This was bought for our year old son. He’s a big kid and it fits him pretty well. The only thing we don’t like is that the shape of it makes it hard for him to hold his head up straight when he’s sitting in our bike trailer. I think that’s just the nature of the him wearing a helmet. There are complains about them falling apart on here. We’ve used it 10-15 times now and have had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: jregb

customer_reviews.title: Strap broke
customer_reviews.text: Straps broke after a few weeks of use. It's suppose to protect the child. Poor quality. What a disappointment. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Great for our Toddler
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 16mo daughter so she could join us on bike rides. It is adjustable and fits well. The chin strap is a little loose, but she’ll grow into it. The helmet fits her average sized head very well. It doesn’t seem uncomfortable for her at all, and it doesn’t feel like it’s moving around during use. The visor seems to shield the sun from her eyes well. I like this a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Katie F.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, breaks easily.
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had two of these helmets and both have broken relatively easily. The dial adjustment on the back seems to tighten itself while it’s on, so I have to loosen it every time to fit it on my kid’s head. The pad under the buckle makes it difficult for my kids to buckle themselves. It is a cheap helmet and you get what you pay for. Next time I’ll pay a little more.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel & Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Very happy - repeat purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I first purchased this helmet for my first daughter a year ago, and just now bought a second one for my younger daughter :) Love that it is dial-adjustable in the back to get a good fit. That was key when I was researching helmets. My 3 year old is learning to ride her own bike now and after a couple spills the helmet did not budge. Not even when she (almost) face-planted on the asphalt. The brim is solid and protected her face/teeth, thank goodness! She has never complained about putting it on, so I assume it must be comfy enough too.
customer_reviews.author: amela

customer_reviews.title: Finally Found One that Fits!
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old daughter has a super small head and finding a helmet that fits has been a huge struggle. I actually had her in a hockey helmet for a while because its the only one I could find that would stay on her head. Anyways, the x-small/small size fits my petite 6 year old perfectly - with room to grow!
customer_reviews.author: CocoThe Slug

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Fits great. He loves wearing it. He does sweat but it is Texas so it's expected and I can't say whether he'd be hot in another climate. I will note that I got the same helmet in another color for his twin sister and it did not work for her head shape. Super happy with this purchase and with all of our Joovy gear.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Momma

customer_reviews.title: Fits my 7 mo old great! Room to grow as well!
customer_reviews.text: Great helmet that meets US standards. Easy to adjust for my 7 mo old noggin. Stays in place the entire ride without it coming down over his eyes like I worried about before purchasing. Nice color options, trusted brand, and my little man has room to grow into it as it’s easily adjustable. Comfortable chin strap and removable pads for cleaning!
customer_reviews.author: lorenzo

customer_reviews.title: Great helmet for kids
customer_reviews.text: Compared to what I could find in Target, REI, and the local bike store, this is very good helmet for the $$. You can spend more for highest quality helmet from the local bike store but a 3 yr old is not going to ride technical trails that require commensurate quality of protection. The nieces love the helmet, and I love that it has adjustable dial for comfortable and snug fit (please don't buy cheap kids helmet without adjustable straps...it's just not worth it) and good helmet coverage over sides of head.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We got a not so good strap
customer_reviews.text: Straps fell off somehow while my son was riding on his scooter by the time we noticed it. Too late! We walked the path up and down and no longer could find it.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Cummings

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to adjust!  Red is more faded and pink than shown.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my 4 year old who has outgrown his original “Cars” helmet. This fits great and is so easy to adjust. He has plenty of room to grow with it. I only gave it four stars because of the color. He wanted his helmet to match his bike so we ordered red. The red was very faded looking. I had planned on overlooking it but once we took it outside on the sun it showed up almost pink. I have no problem with him wearing a pink helmet but he was upset it didn’t match his bike and the color on the site was misleading. We are exchanging it for the black one.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Buckle strap broke upon first adjustment.
customer_reviews.text: Buckle broke off upon arrival as I was trying to loosen the strap to fit my child’s head. The sewn part just came apart so the buckle fell. For a more pricey helmet I was surprised. Helmet itself seemed great so was disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Julared

customer_reviews.title: Be careful clicking the chin strap
customer_reviews.text: The Helmet is amazing and I love it however I wish the strap was made for a toddler. What I mean is if you have ever had to click one of those straps on a struggling toddler you will know the dangers of pinching their chin neck, which I did thus scaring him of the helmet. A snap on side for the toddler maybe? And possibly a exchangeable strap as they grow to this style of clip
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca L

customer_reviews.title: Great helmet!!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this helmet!! I looked around for quite a bit to try and find the right helmet and decided on this one. So glad I did! We started going for bike rides when my son was only 11 months old so we needed something that would fit his head but grow with him. This is very easy to adjust with the dial knob in the back and we continue to use the helmet even now that he's 23 months old. Seems comfortable for him with plenty of padding and he's never complained about it.
customer_reviews.author: DanielleTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 20mo old for Xmas a d so far it’s been great. She loves wearing it so I’m guessing it’s comfy. It was also easy to adjust. I also have one for my 3 year old that’s now a year old. No big falls on with but the older one has some crack on the plastic surface which could be from the helmet falling out of the trunk of our suv or sun damage (she leaves it lying around sometimes) over all a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mariana B.

customer_reviews.title: Helmet fits, but straps fray and make it useless
customer_reviews.text: Cute helmet, fits my 38lb, tall 3yo... but we’ve had it for a month and the strap is frayed to the point we almost can’t adjust it anymore. It wiggles loose and slides back off his head because we can’t keep the chin strap tight. It isn’t doing anything to protect his noggin if it doesn’t stay put.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Clapp

customer_reviews.title: Toddler-approved.
customer_reviews.text: I bought helmet after I saw crappy ones at Walmart. I like this one because it adjusted well (tightened) on my nephew’s head using the little round crank. My son is 2 1/2 and I bought him the s/m... a little big but after tightened it is perfect. Love the color.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth R.

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves this!
customer_reviews.text: My almost 2-year-old daughter loves this helmet. She will wear it anywhere, even inside the house. It must be really comfortable for her because she isn't asking to take it off. Once she starts using the scooters and other vehicles a bit more this is going to be put to heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: A little big but works
customer_reviews.text: This is bigger then our lil one previous helmet. It does sit bigger on there head, but it does cover more. We haven't used it on a nice ride so I'm afraid that it will not have enough air flow to keep there lil head cool. But in all I feel more comfortable with this helmet and it does have room for growth.
customer_reviews.author: duvane dorsey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect toddler helmet!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely perfect first helmet for my 2 year old. She is very small for her age range, the sizing guide is very helpful and spot on. It fits perfectly snug and because of the adjustable interior piece she will be able to use it for quite some time! Very pleased, and happy to know she is well protected.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Krueger

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 3 year old as he transitioned to a 12" bike from a tricycle. He claims it is comfortable and it appears to fit him well. I appreciate the adjustable knob inside allowing him to wear it now with a lot of room to grow.
customer_reviews.author: JMU

customer_reviews.title: Best fitting for toddlers I've found
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the smaller size for my 21 month old toddler. Fits like a glove and so easy to put on. Super cute, dark pink, with nice ventilation and padding. Some of the pads can be removed if needed but haven't reached that point yet. This will last at least a year if not more, which for baby products that's impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Beth

customer_reviews.title: cute but small for 4 year old girl
customer_reviews.text: it's a super cute helmet but i had to return it cause it was too small for my 4 year old niece. to be perfectly honest i was only buying it because i bought her a scooter to ride around inside the office (my sisters & i work together) so an indoor office scooter helmet wasn't the most necessary thing in the world & probably could have tried harder to adjust & make it fit. we also tend to have large heads in my family - not even joking.
customer_reviews.author: lea j

customer_reviews.title: Size runs a little small
customer_reviews.text: Slightly disappointed that the helmet came with the foam part damaged. The box also came ruined which probably was the reason it was damaged. Otherwise I think the helmet would’ve been perfect. It does wrap around the head and protects well, but I think the size runs a little small..
customer_reviews.author: AmyK

customer_reviews.title: Helmet safety
customer_reviews.text: My petite 2 year old is loving her helmet. And I love it too! Beautiful bright pink color. Helmet is light weight. On the back there is a little flat knob that you can twist to tighten the helmet and get the perfect fit. She took a big spill on her balance bike and helmet stayed on and she was safe. Wish I had bought this helmet when my other kids were younger.
customer_reviews.author: Alark

customer_reviews.title: Another cheap Chinese product!
customer_reviews.text: They hit the minimum requirements out of the park (if we had baseball right now). It looks like it would protect a toddler's head nuf said. If you enjoy the appearance of protection (masks made out of t-shirts, etc.), this is your helmet!
customer_reviews.author: Texan

customer_reviews.title: When your ready to move up from the Xsmall
customer_reviews.text: We already had the previous version of the Noodle in pink (which now the Xsmall/small size) and it was a great product for our daughter from 2-4 years old. Once she began complaining that it was a little tight we passed that one down to the little sister and upgraded to the new Noodle size small/medium. Great fit, great product.
customer_reviews.author: marie

customer_reviews.title: THE COLOR RED HAS CHANGED
customer_reviews.text: IF YOU ARE LOOKING FOR A TRUE RED DON'T ORDER THIS. I PREVIOUSLY ORDERED A RED ONE BACK IN SEPT. 2017 AND THE COLOR WAS RED......A TRUE RED. THE ONE I JUST RECEIVED THE COLOR RED IS QUITE WATERED DOWN IN OTHER WORDS THE COLOR LOOKS LIKE A FADED PINKISH RED. DOES NOT LOOK NOTHING LIKE THE RED IN THE PICTURE THEY SHOW.
customer_reviews.author: Benna

customer_reviews.title: Great kids helmet, fits well if you properly adjust
customer_reviews.text: This is a great kids helmet. It fits my 1 year old very well and is easy to adjust, especially with the "dial" size adjuster on the back (just like my adult helmet). Should be able to fit for quite a while with the range of adjustment. It gives good coverage.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Grandparent Security
customer_reviews.text: Bought for our 2YO granddaughter. She is not riding a bike independently yet but shares a ride on mom or dad’s bike so I wanted to get her some protection. Fits well and she likes the pink color. It’s a little big for her head but she’ll grow into it.
customer_reviews.author: Kokomo

customer_reviews.title: Major disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I would NOT recommend this product to anyone! It broke the first time my son used it. The clip that attaches under his chin slipped right off so we couldn’t even secure his helmet on the ride back to our house. Now we have no way to secure this under his chin so the helmet is pretty much useless. Spend a little more and get a better quality product. Super disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Corinne

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service from Joovy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great helmet and was working well for our son from age of 1 until this spring. One day on a ride, somehow the strap "broke" (or my toddler yanking on it broke it). I immediately emailed the company to get a replacement and they were super helpful. Turned out it wasn't completely broken and was a pretty easy fix.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow to fit onto head; adjustable size only accommodates front-back size variation.
customer_reviews.text: This helmet is well made and we love the color. It is adjustable in size, however we found that it will not fit on our 2 y.o.'s head. The helmet shape/contour and adjustment seem to be designed for a child with a longer head (front-to-back), whereas the helmet width is too narrow to fit. Even at the loosest setting, it will not fit onto his head, although there appears to be plenty of "extra" room in the front or back sections of the helmet. Maybe our son's head is just too wide/fat.
customer_reviews.author: Christine & Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy helmets for 18m - 3.5y kids (so far)
customer_reviews.text: Great helmets. Each of our kids has one and they fit great and are comfortable. Nobody complains about having to wear it and it has keep their heads from hitting the pavement a handful of times. Worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa C.

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: If the chin strap has a chin protector, that would have been great. My 3 year old fell riding his kick-board and scrapped his chin... only wish it had chin protector on the chin strap...
customer_reviews.author: Sojukilla

customer_reviews.title: Where are the M/L and L/XL sizes?
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Joovy helmet for my 5 year old niece who is African-American. Her mom said the helmet fit snug after it was dialed all the way out. I loved the color and style but I didn't see larger sizes. All kids are not the same size regardless of ages and hair is different. It would be nice if larger kids sizes to select from. I am returning the helmet but learned no QR code was offered so the label had to get printed. Provide a QR code for easier return. I think it is a very cute helmet and loved the color.
customer_reviews.author: See More

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a toddler
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this helmet for almost two year old. We tried few helmets but they were not snug, this one fits perfect. If you have early rider, you should definitely consider getting this helmet. It fits small heads!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Perfect helmut for a tiny head
customer_reviews.text: My 2yo is tiny (7th percentile for weight, 18th for height, 42nd for head circumference), so I was worried that this wouldn't be snug and secure enough to keep her safe, but I needn't have. I got the Small, and it was super easy and quick to adjust. Importantly, too, my daughter is comfortable in it. I bought the Large for my 4yo and had the same experience -- it's a great helmet.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah P. Miller

customer_reviews.title: My 2 year old loves it
customer_reviews.text: She is all about riding bikes now. At first she was scared of the helmet, but now, she does not want to take it off. It looks great, feels sturdy and sits perfect on her head. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: T0B1

customer_reviews.title: Color off, not durable
customer_reviews.text: This helmet is more a pink/mauve than the bright red I was led to expect in the picture. It also has a crack in it already- only been used twice by a toddler, no falls, so not sure how it even happened.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Great helmet!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great helmet for toddlers. It's easy to use and adjust, and there are a bunch of air holes to help keep the head cool. We bought it for my 3-year-old. According to her growth charts, she should have been right at the low end of the range for sizing, but in practice, the size needs to be adjusted to somewhere in the middle. Maybe it runs a little small? In any case, it still fits and will fit for a while yet. We love it and wish we could buy one in a larger size when she grows out of this one.
customer_reviews.author: SBNB

customer_reviews.title: JUst what our 13month old needed!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered the xs/sm for our 13m old and it fits great with a little room to grow. He's a big boy with a good size noggin so if your little one has a smaller head ir is under 1 it may be too large.
customer_reviews.author: LJB

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit!!!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old granddaughter was a bit reluctant to put it on when we suggested it. We left it on the floor and she decided on her own to try it on. It fit her head perfectly - snug but not too tight! She kept wearing it off and on all day. We went for a walk and she ended up tripping, falling down and the helmet took the brunt of the impact! She didn't even cry when it happened. I highly recommend this helmet for toddlers!!!
customer_reviews.author: KKWink

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend for kids!
customer_reviews.text: This is the fourth time we are buying a Joovy helmet for our kids - they are so great! They are easy to use, adjust, and the kids don't complain about having them on. Very lightweight but feel sturdy. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: RosieChics

customer_reviews.title: Buy this helmet
customer_reviews.text: I looked into other brands of helmets for my 2 year old son, but didn't like the obnoxious characters most had. Yes, this is a little more pricey than some, but since its plain and comes in gender neutral color options I will be able to pass onto my daughter once my son grow out of it. The helmet itself it super lightweight and comfortable on his head. I love the adjustable knob feature to make finding the perfect fit easy. I definitely recommend this helmet to everyone, if you're on the fence - choose this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall very good
customer_reviews.text: It's very good, but not excellent. The straps are a little bit too long for my two year old... I can't make them any shorter as the triangle formed by the sides won't let me close/tight them any further. She is a normal 48 inch head size, but as I said, I'm still playing a bit with the strap. The color pink is better than expected.
customer_reviews.author: lo

customer_reviews.title: Value for Money
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for a good helmet for 9 year old and this one works perfectly. The quality of the material is good and conformable to wear. Handling weight over our head is very relative but this helmet is light enough for long usage. We had ordered Greenie on which can be seen from a distance and easily visible at evening hours.
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: Perfect helmet for babies and toddlers
customer_reviews.text: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE these helmets. At first I thought they were a little pricey, but they are definitely worth the price. They fit perfectly on my one-year-old's head and on my three-year-old's head. You can adjust the back and the strap for a perfect fit. I don't have to worry about wobbly helmets. update: my kids are now 5 and 7 and they don’t fit on either of them. I tried my daughter’s helmet on my 5 year old son, and it’s way too tight. I mention that because I did a search for helmets for kids 5-8 years old and these exact sizes came up.
customer_reviews.author: edith

customer_reviews.title: Really cute, fits great
customer_reviews.text: Fits our 16 month old and her 92th% head with a little room to grow, and it doesn't look enormous - just looks like a cute-ass helmet. Easy to adjust, easy to put on and take off. Great, overall.
customer_reviews.author: MetaMeta

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Adjust. Fits well.
customer_reviews.text: My toddler loves this helmet. It fits his head perfectly and the color is cute. We have not had any falls yet, but it looks like it'll serve his noggin well. It was easy to adjust. Of course, it is hot to wear, so my toddler gets a sweaty head pretty quickly while wearing it, but that's pretty normal. He loves wearing it and asks for it even when he's not biking.
customer_reviews.author: S. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Best helmet!
customer_reviews.text: My son was sad when he grew out of his first Joovy noodle, so I’m thankful Joovy made a bigger size! The medium fits him great with room to grow (just turned 3). Joovy, please make larger sizes for growing heads...other brands don’t compare.
customer_reviews.author: Britt

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable
customer_reviews.text: Being able to adjust this child's bike helmet is a wonderful feature and one of the the reasons I purchased it. Our son bought a helmet that is not adjustable and our granddaughter won't wear it because its too tight. The other reason that I love this helmet is because it has ample vents to let the heat out so our granddaughter doesn't over heat.
customer_reviews.author: Pookey Pants

customer_reviews.title: Good protection and fit for 2 year old
customer_reviews.text: I like the coverage of this helmet on my 2 year old’s head. At first it took her a little while to get used to wearing it (at about 18 months), as it is a little big and bulky, but she gradually grew in to it better and now doesn’t mind wearing it.
customer_reviews.author: Vedi

customer_reviews.title: Easily adjustable
customer_reviews.text: I love the ease of adjusting this helmet size. Our youngest has been wearing it from 10 months until 1 year and i think it will continue to grow with him for several years.
customer_reviews.author: D M

customer_reviews.title: Good toddler helmet
customer_reviews.text: Bought this helmet for my one year old for our daily bike rides. It fits him perfectly, is easily adjustable, and he doesn’t seem to mind wearing it at all. I also like all the color options, we went with orange for visibility. Only suggestion would be to add the mesh bug guards to all the gaps rather than just the front ones. Overall a nice toddler helmet for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: magnum

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow. Ok
customer_reviews.text: Too narrow to fit her head even though it should have fit her with an xtra inch to inch & a half. But great quality. Will order larger size immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah

customer_reviews.title: Great first helmet
customer_reviews.text: Excellent helmet, very cute, sturdy, and very adjustable. Fits my daughter great, she will be three in a few months, and there is definitely lots of room to grow into it.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Ruotolo

customer_reviews.title: Did not fit  2 or 3 year old
customer_reviews.text: I wish it would have worked. It seemed like great quality, the colors were vibrant (I bought orange and red), the turn dial adjuster was easy to use. However, it did not fit either of my boys' heads. I have a two year old and a 3 year old. I measured their heads before buying the helmets but I literally could not get the helmet on either of them.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Menken

customer_reviews.title: Great xs bike helmet for baby/toddler
customer_reviews.text: Needed a helmet small enough for my 1year old. This is it. Light weight, and didn’t push his head too far forward while riding in the bike trailer. Found it easy to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Great helmet but strap broke after a few uses.
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this a week ago and it’s been used a few times. The strap broke. I tried threading it back through but if you pulled on it, the strap would easily loosen and pull all the way out. Bummed because we like everything else about it. The dial is great and it fits well. Not sure if I want to order a new one or purchase a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my kiddo. Comfortable and they don’t mind wearing it. A little pricey but well made and I feel like it’s going to last awhile. Will order same brand in the future
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this helmet!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this helmet! Fits great! Easy to adjust, if needed. We ordered the pink one for our petite 2 year old granddaughter and she loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: built-in visor will work in event of a forward fall (it's not designed to keep the sun out of her eyes) easy to clip and the pin
customer_reviews.text: It is solidly made, built-in visor will work in event of a forward fall (it's not designed to keep the sun out of her eyes) easy to clip and the pinch-preventing pad does it's job. Though it actually is a bit large for my daughter's head, even though she measured right in the middle of the circumference range; - the adjustable wheel in the back helps, but the straps can only be shortened so far and it fits her looser than ideal. I'm glad it will grow with her a bit, but do wish I could adjust the straps on both sides, rather than just one. Overall, an excellent value, no need to spend more.
customer_reviews.author: Mother Nurture

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: My 2 yr old fits in this with room to grow. She loves it and we bought the tricycle with it. Best 2nd birthday present ever. Wish they made infant elbow pads and knee pads that match!
customer_reviews.author: Victor Lau

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality on chin clasp
customer_reviews.text: We’ve only had this helmet for my 2 year old for 3.5 months, she’s maybe worn it 8 times, has never fallen with it, and the clasp is already broken. Very disappointed. We liked it a lot at first but it seems to be poorly made if the chin clasp already broke for no reason.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Ostroth

customer_reviews.title: STRAPS ARE TOO LONG
customer_reviews.text: Love the color! However, the straps are way to long. I've adjusted them to as tight as I can and it hangs below my daughter's chin around 1-2 inches! I might return it.
customer_reviews.author: Texican

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price for a great toddler helmet
customer_reviews.text: This little helmet was a present for my 19 month old and fit him great (bought a small for reference). There’s enough room to grow a little bit, but it’s most important to fit now! It’s very difficult to find a high quality solid color helmet for toddlers so I would buy again despite the high cost.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 2

customer_reviews.title: mystery crack
customer_reviews.text: Just noticed a crack in the shell running down the side/temple on one side. Maybe she threw it to the ground, we don't know, but a bit concerning. Will take a chance and order a new one to get her to the more sturdy models age group.
customer_reviews.author: sean

customer_reviews.title: Strap broke after 2 uses
customer_reviews.text: It is a lightweight helmet and my daughter feels comfortable wearing it but the strap broke after second use. I'm going to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Arun Karnati

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: My daughter looks super cute in it. I love the twist design on the back of the helmet to quickly tighten and loosen so that it is perfectly adjusted to her head. I like the helmet is light compared to another helmet that I already had. Will recommend to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Way too small
customer_reviews.text: Prior to purchasing this helmet, I read the great reviews and measured my child's head: 20 inches. Yes, for a child under age two, he has a big head, but I thought that he would still be able to use this helmet, given the measurements. Nope. Even the largest setting was way small for him. I wish this company made a next size up for kids. Love the helmet, can't make it fit.
customer_reviews.author: stpauldogs

customer_reviews.title: GOOD QUALITY  -  WELL-DESIGNED CHIN STRAP
customer_reviews.text: PRODUCT IS TRUE TO SIZE + CLIPS ON EASILY. ADJUSTABLE, FITS OUR 2 YR OLD. FEATURES COUPLE OF REMOVABLE PADS TO ACCOMODATE GROWTH OF APPROX 1/2" - 1" . ARRIVED PROMPTLY, BETTER THAN THE BELL HELMET WE RETURNED BECAUSE SIZING WASN'T AS DESCRIBED.
customer_reviews.author: linda r.

product_meta.title: Joovy Noodle Helmet Small-Medium, Kids Helmet, Bike Helmet, Blue
product_meta.description: Color:Blue| Size:Small/MediumWe feel that it's never too early to set a good example, especially when it comes to safety. At Joovy, we believe teaching children early about safety and creating good safety habits is an essential part of parenting. That's exactly why we developed the Noodle helmet. The Noodle helmet is for children with a head size between 18.5-20.5" (47-52 cm)(Small Helmet) and 20.5-22 (52-56 cm)(Medium Helmet) . We recommend using it when children ride bikes, trikes, ride-on cars, scooters, bike trailers and other activities like these. The Joovy Noodle features 14 air vents, with integrated bug mesh in the front vents, extended visor for maximum protection, nylon straps, pinch guard chin strap, and an adjustable fit dial. It is a great looking helmet and comes in various colors. Meets CPSC Standards.
feature_bullets: 14 air vents with integrated bug mesh in the front vents
Extended visor for maximum protection, nylon straps, pinch guard chin strap
Adjustable fit dial - turn right to tighten and left to loosen
Complies with U.S. CPSC Safety Standard for Bicycle Helmets for Persons Age 1 and Older (Extended Head Coverage
Available in two sizes: Small (18.5-20.5 inches) and Medium (20.5-22 inches); Use a string and tape measure to measure your child’s head

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars3,099 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
